result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:07)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Schlough - have resolution but have slight issue - deft can't make a knowing plea this morning
Court address the Deft - Deft requests additional time to understand the agreement
COURT:  directs counsel to talk - moves hearing to end of morning at 11:30
State - no objection to moving matter to end of morning
(10:11)  matter adjourned until 11:30

(11:55)  RECALLED - same parties appear

State - 15CF384 plea to Ct 1 & 2 - dismiss and readin Ct 3 & 4 and 16CF15
Deft is ready to go forward

Deft  15CF384 Ct 1 pleads guilty)  waives rights & JT
                         Ct 2 pleads guilty)  waives rights & JT
Court questions deft
State - have agreement - victim rights have complied with
Deft - is still okay for Judge Smeltzer to sit on this matter
Victim addresses the court - is happy with recommendation
State - recommends 36 months probation imposed and stayed & stayed 3yr IC 4yrs ES - eligible for treatment court - she will get the mental and drug treatment she needs - not possess or be in presence of controlled substa or paraph., $518 on each count, complete 60 days jail done up front 180 days imposed and stayed 
Schlough - addresses the court
Deft - address the court 

COURT:  15CF384 Ct 1 & 2 pleas voluntary - finds deft guilty to both
$568 cc on each count - BOND APPLIES
w/held sentence 36 months probation on each count Concurrent
complete Treatment Court
180 days jail to be used at discretion of DOC agent
10/14/16 report to jail for 29 days then report again 12/16/16 for 29 days
Huber release for any treatment purposes
comply with Human Services
not possess or be in presence of controlled substances not prescribed to deft or paraph
AODA & follow thru and any treatment recommended thru Treatment Court
no alcohol
credit 10 days if revoked

DISMISS & READ-IN: 15CF384 Ct 3 & 4, 16CF15

Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:36)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Schlough - argues continuance 
Victims present in court

COURT:  grants short continuance
bond continues
  Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:09)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - have met and discussed the case - requests DE be evaluated for treatment court - attempts made to contact her 
Schlough - get in contact with Ms Brantner after court today
State - DE hasn't showed up

COURT:  bonds continues
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:20)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Schlough - waives reading in both - pleads not guilty in both - requests pretrial dates

COURT:  bonds continue

Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:30)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.

State - calls Inv. Westlund - sworn

State - argues and that all counts are transactionally related
Burger - no argument

16CF15 prelim

State - argues
Burger - argues

bonds continues
discloses Judge knows parties involved on both sides - discuss it with your attorney
  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
